sentences.english: I reckon we'll climb down there and have a hunt for that box.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们该从那里爬下去找那箱财宝。

sentences.english: Pray for people in Gao an to seek eternal treasure in Christ.
sentences.chinese: 为高安居民祷告，愿他们在基督里寻找永恒的财宝。

sentences.english: I can’t endure the leisured man’s measures for the treasures in the treasury.
sentences.chinese: 我不能容忍那个悠闲男子对金库财宝采取的措施。

sentences.english: The police found the lost treasure in an abandoned well.
sentences.chinese: 警察在一口废弃的井里找到了丢失的财宝。

sentences.english: Thieves break into the palace and steal the king's treasure.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼破门进入宫殿偷走了国王的金银财宝。

sentences.english: And I'll give you much treasure.
sentences.chinese: 你行行好吧，我给你许多金银财宝。

sentences.english: The leisured man took no measure for the treasure in the treasury.
sentences.chinese: 那个悠闲的男子对金库里的财宝没有采取措施。

sentences.english: Thus King Solomon excelled all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 所罗门王的财宝与智慧胜过天下的列王。

sentences.english: The sons supposed that he referred to some hidden treasure.
sentences.chinese: 几个儿子以为父亲说的是他藏着什么金银财宝。

sentences.english: Legend has it that there are lots of treasures on the treasure mountain.
sentences.chinese: 传说中的宝山上藏有很多财宝。

sentences.english: He that first cries out stop thief, is often he that has stolen the treasure.
sentences.chinese: 最选喊抓贼的人，常常是偷了财宝的人。

sentences.english: He that gathereth treasures by a lying tongue, is vain and foolish, and shall stumble upon the snares of death.
sentences.chinese: 以谎言伪语骗得的财宝，是浮云轻烟，死亡的罗网。

sentences.english: Enemy soldiers ransacked the city and carried off its treasures.
sentences.chinese: 敌兵洗劫了这座城市，掠走了城中的财宝。

sentences.english: It goes to show what stupendously bad Treasury stewardship can do.
sentences.chinese: 它去显示什么坏财宝管理工作可能特好地做。

sentences.english: And I answered him, "I will go for half of thy treasure.
sentences.chinese: 我于是回答他，‘我只为你的半壁财宝而离开。

sentences.english: In selling all he had to buy that field. To gain the treasure it would yield.
sentences.chinese: 他卖了他所有的来买这块田，来获得财宝。

definition: precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
